t: Luke 12
Beware of Religious Hypocrisy

Meanwhile,*p a crowd of many thousands came together, so that they were trampling on one another. He began to say to his disciples first, “Be*r on*r your*r guard*r against*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees,*r which*r is*r hypocrisy.*r
There*r is*r nothing*r covered*r that*r won’t*r be*r uncovered,*r nothing*r hidden*r that*r won’t*r be*r made*r known.*r

Therefore,*r whatever*r you*r have*r said*r in*r the*r dark*r will*r be*r heard*r in*r the*r light,*r and*r what*r you*r have*r whispered*r in*r an*r ear*r in*r private*r rooms*r will*r be*r proclaimed*r on*r the*r housetops.*r
Fear God
“I*rp say*r to*r you,*r my*r friends,*r don’t*r fear*r those*r who*r kill*r the*r body,*r and*r after*r that*r can*r do*r nothing*r more.*r

But*r I*r will*r show*r you*r the*r one*r to*r fear:*r Fear*r him*r who*r has*r authority*r to*r throw*r people*r into*r hell*r after*r death.*r Yes,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r this*r is*r the*r one*r to*r fear!*r
Aren’t*r five*r sparrows*r sold*r for*r two*r pennies?*r Yet*r not*r one*r of*r them*r is*r forgotten*r in*r God’s*r sight.*r
Indeed,*r the*r hairs*r of*r your*r head*r are*r all*r counted.*r Don’t*r be*r afraid;*r you*r are*r worth*r more*r than*r many*r sparrows.*r
Acknowledging Christ
“And*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r anyone*r who*r acknowledges*r me*r before*r others,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r also*r acknowledge*r him*r before*r the*r angels*r of*r God,*r
but*r whoever*r denies*r me*r before*r others*r will*r be*r denied*r before*r the*r angels*r of*r God.*r
Anyone*r who*r speaks*r a*r word*r against*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r forgiven,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r blasphemes*r against*r the*r Holy*r Spirit*r will*r not*r be*r forgiven.*r

For*r the*r Holy*r Spirit*r will*r teach*r you*r at*r that*r very*r hour*r what*r must*r be*r said.”*r
The Parable of the Rich Fool
Someone*p from the crowd said to him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”
“Friend,”*rp he said to him, “who*r appointed*r me*r a*r judge*r or*r arbitrator*r over*r you?”*r
He then told them, “Watch*r out*r and*r be*r on*r guard*r against*r all*r greed,*r because*r one’s*r life*r is*r not*r in*r the*r abundance*r of*r his*r possessions.”*r
Then*p he told them a parable: “A*r rich*r man’s*r land*r was*r very*r productive.*r
He*r thought*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r should*r I*r do,*r since*r I*r don’t*r have*r anywhere*r to*r store*r my*r crops?*r
I*r will*r do*r this,’*r he*r said.*r ‘I’ll*r tear*r down*r my*r barns*r and*r build*r bigger*r ones*r and*r store*r all*r my*r grain*r and*r my*r goods*r there.*r
Then*r I’ll*r say*r to*r myself,*r “You*r have*r many*r goods*r stored*r up*r for*r many*r years.*r Take*r it*r easy;*r eat,*r drink,*r and*r enjoy*r yourself.”’*r
“But*rp God*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘You*r fool!*r This*r very*r night*r your*r life*r is*r demanded*r of*r you.*r And*r the*r things*r you*r have*r prepared — whose*r will*r they*r be?’*r
“That’s*rp how*r it*r is*r with*r the*r one*r who*r stores*r up*r treasure*r for*r himself*r and*r is*r not*r rich*r toward*r God.”*r
The Cure for Anxiety
Then*p he said to his disciples, “Therefore*r I*r tell*r you,*r don’t*r worry*r about*r your*r life,*r what*r you*r will*r eat;*r or*r about*r the*r body,*r what*r you*r will*r wear.*r

If*r then*r you’re*r not*r able*r to*r do*r even*r a*r little*r thing,*r why*r worry*r about*r the*r rest?*r

“Consider*rp how*r the*r wildflowers*r grow:*r They*r don’t*r labor*r or*r spin*r thread.*r Yet*r I*r tell*r you,*r not*r even*r Solomon*r in*r all*r his*r splendor*r was*r adorned*r like*r one*r of*r these.*r

Don’t*r strive*r for*r what*r you*r should*r eat*r and*r what*r you*r should*r drink,*r and*r don’t*r be*r anxious.*r
For*r the*r Gentile*r world*r eagerly*r seeks*r all*r these*r things,*r and*r your*r Father*r knows*r that*r you*r need*r them.*r
“But*rp seek*r his*r kingdom,*r and*r these*r things*r will*r be*r provided*r for*r you.*r
Don’t*r be*r afraid,*r little*r flock,*r because*r your*r Father*r delights*r to*r give*r you*r the*r kingdom.*r

Sell*r your*r possessions*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor.*r Make*r money-bags*r for*r yourselves*r that*r won’t*r grow*r old,*r an*r inexhaustible*r treasure*r in*r heaven,*r where*r no*r thief*r comes*r near*r and*r no*r moth*r destroys.*r
For*r where*r your*r treasure*r is,*r there*r your*r heart*r will*r be*r also.*r
Ready for the Master’s Return
“Be*rp ready*r for*r service*r and*r have*r your*r lamps*r lit.*r

You*r are*r to*r be*r like*r people*r waiting*r for*r their*r master*r to*r return*r from*r the*r wedding*r banquet*r so*r that*r when*r he*r comes*r and*r knocks,*r they*r can*r open*r the*r door*r for*r him*r at*r once.*r

Blessed*r will*r be*r those*r servants*r the*r master*r finds*r alert*r when*r he*r comes.*r Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r he*r will*r get*r ready,*r have*r them*r recline*r at*r the*r table,*r then*r come*r and*r serve*r them.*r
If*r he*r comes*r in*r the*r middle*r of*r the*r night,*r or*r even*r near*r dawn,*r and*r finds*r them*r alert,*r blessed*r are*r those*r servants.*r
But*r know*r this:*r If*r the*r homeowner*r had*r known*r at*r what*r hour*r the*r thief*r was*r coming,*r he*r would*r not*r have*r let*r his*r house*r be*r broken*r into.*r
You*r also*r be*r ready,*r because*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r coming*r at*r an*r hour*r you*r do*r not*r expect.”*r
Rewards and Punishment
“Lord,”*p Peter asked, “are you telling this parable to us or to everyone?”

The*p Lord said, “Who*r then*r is*r the*r faithful*r and*r sensible*r manager*r his*r master*r will*r put*r in*r charge*r of*r his*r household*r servants*r to*r give*r them*r their*r allotted*r food*r at*r the*r proper*r time?*r

Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r he*r will*r put*r him*r in*r charge*r of*r all*r his*r possessions.*r

Not Peace but Division

They*irpn will*ir be*ir divided,*ir father*ir against*ir son,*ir son*irln against*ir father,*ir mother*irln against*ir daughter,*ir daughter*irln against*ir mother,*ir mother-in-law*irln against*ir her*ir daughter-in-law,*ir and*irln daughter-in-law*ir against*ir mother-in-law.”*ir
Interpreting the Time
He*p also said to the crowds, “When*r you*r see*r a*r cloud*r rising*r in*r the*r west,*r right*r away*r you*r say,*r ‘A*r storm*r is*r coming,’*r and*r so*r it*r does.*r
